remark.p: Foreign Service Officer. Under Secretary of State for Political Affairs; Secretary of State ad interim; Assistant Secretary of State for East Asian and Pacific Affairs; Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary (Korea).
Counselor for Political Affairs at the Embassy in Korea from January 1962
Political Officer at the Embassy in Vietnam
Minister-Counselor at the Embassy in Vietnam; Deputy Assistant Secretary of East Asian and Pacific Affairs after June 1967
Deputy Assistant Secretary of State, Bureau of East Asian and Pacific Affairs, and Member, U.S. Delegation to the Paris Peace Talks
Deputy Assistant Secretary, Bureau of East Asian and Pacific Affairs, and member, U.S. Delegation to the Paris Peace Talks
Deputy Assistant Secretary of State for East Asian and Pacific Affairs after June 1967

Counselor for Political Affairs, Embassy in Korea until June 6, 1966; Political Officer, Embassy in Vietnam, until April 1967; Deputy Assistant Secretary of State for East Asian and Pacific Affairs after June 1967
Deputy Assistant Secretary of State for East Asian and Pacific Affairs until May 1969; thereafter Deputy Head of the U.S. Delegation to the Paris Peace Talks on Vietnam.
member of the U.S. Delegation to Paris Peace Talks, and Deputy to Ambassadors Lodge and Bruce from May 1968 until October 1971
U.S. Ambassador to South Korea

member, U.S. Delegation to the Paris Peace Talks from May 1968 until October 1971; Ambassador to Korea from September 30, 1971, until August 19, 1974; Assistant Secretary of State for East Asian and Pacific Affairs from September 27, 1974
Assistant Secretary of State for East Asian and Pacific Affairs from September 27, 1974 until June 30, 1976; thereafter, Under Secretary of State for Political Affairs

Deputy Assistant Secretary of State for East Asian and Pacific Affairs until May 1969; member of U.S. delegation to the Paris Peace Talks until October 1971; Ambassador to Korea from September 30, 1971

Ambassador to Korea until August 19, 1974; Assistant Secretary of State for East Asian and Pacific Affairs from September 27, 1974 until June 30, 1976; Under Secretary of State for Political Affairs from July 1, 1976

Deputy Assistant Secretary of State for East Asian and Pacific Affairs until May 1969; member, U.S. Delegation to meetings on Vietnam in Paris from May 1968 until October 1971; Ambassador to Korea from September 30, 1971
Deputy Assistant Secretary of State for East Asian and Pacific Affairs until May 1969; member of U.S. delegation to the Paris Peace Talks until October 1971; thereafter, Ambassador to Korea
Under Secretary of State for Political Affairs from June 1976
Assistant Secretary of State, Bureau of East Asian and Pacific Affairs from September 1974 until June 1976; Under Secretary of State for Political Affairs from June 1976
Assistant Secretary of State for East Asian and Pacific Affairs from September 27, 1974 until June 30, 1976
Assistant Secretary of State for East Asian and Pacific Affairs from September 19, 1974 until June 30, 1976

U.S. Ambassador to the Republic of Korea until August 19, 1974; Assistant Secretary of State for East Asian and Pacific Affairs from September 27, 1974, until June 30, 1976; Under Secretary of State for Political Affairs from July 1, 1976, until April 1, 1978; Secretary of State ad interim from January 20, 1977, until January 23, 1977

Ambassador to the Republic of Korea until August 19, 1974; Assistant Secretary of State for East Asian and Pacific Affairs, September 27, 1974–June 30, 1976; Under Secretary of State for Political Affairs, July 1, 1976–April 1, 1978; Secretary of State ad interim, January 20, 1977–January 23, 1977
Deputy Assistant Secretary East Asian and Pacific Affairs, Department of State, from September 1974; Under Secretary for Political Affairs from July 1976

Assistant Secretary of State, Bureau of East Asian and Pacific Affairs from September 1974 to June 1976; Under Secretary of State for Political Affairs, Department of State, from June 1976 to January 1977
Assistant Secretary for East Asian and Pacific Affairs from 1974 to 1977; thereafter Undersecretary of State for Political Affairs
Assistant Secretary of State for East Asian and Pacific Affairs from September 1974 until June 1976; Under Secretary of State for Political Affairs from July 1976 until April 1978

Ambassador to South Korea until August 19, 1974; Assistant Secretary of State for East Asian and Pacific Affairs from September 27, 1974 until June 30, 1976; Under Secretary of State for Political Affairs from July 1, 1976

U.S. Ambassador to South Korea until August 19, 1974; Assistant Secretary of State for East Asian and Pacific Affairs from September 27, 1974 until June 30, 1976; Under Secretary of State for Political Affairs from July 1, 1976
Deputy Assistant Secretary of State for East Asian and Pacific Affairs from September 1974; Under Secretary of State for Political Affairs from July 1976

U.S. Ambassador to the Republic of Korea until August 19, 1974; Assistant Secretary of State for Near Eastern and Pacific Affairs from September 27, 1974, until June 30, 1976; Under Secretary of State for Political Affairs from July 1, 1976

U.S. Ambassador to Korea until August 19, 1974; Assistant Secretary of State for East Asian and Pacific Affairs from September 27, 1974, until June 30, 1976; Under Secretary of State for Political Affairs from July 1, 1976, until April 1, 1978; thereafter Senior Adviser to the Secretary on Caribbean Issues; also Secretary of State ad interim, from January 20 until January 23, 1977
Under Secretary of State for Political Affairs until April 1, 1978; thereafter Senior Adviser to the Secretary of State on Caribbean Issues
Under Secretary of State for Political Affairs from June 1976 until April 1978
Under Secretary of State for Political Affairs from July 1, 1976 until April 1, 1978
Under Secretary of State for Political Affairs from June 16, 1976, until April 1, 1978
Under Secretary of State for Politico-Military Affairs from July 1, 1976, until April 1, 1978; Secretary of State ad interim from January 20, 1977, until January 23, 1977
Under Secretary of State for Political Affairs from July 1, 1976, until April 1, 1978

Assistant Secretary of State for East Asian and Pacific Affairs from September 27, 1974, until June 30, 1976; Under Secretary of State for Political Affairs from June 30, 1976, until April 1, 1978; thereafter Senior Adviser to the Secretary of State on Caribbean Issues; also acting Secretary of State, January 1977
Under Secretary of State for Political Affairs until April 1978; Presidential envoy to the Middle East, 1981
